content: Wonderful adaptation

Start with Sorcery! (1st). The 'Choose Your Own Adventure' books made into a game. I can't imagine how difficult and expensive this game was to create and maintain. Every action creates a different path to reach the end. The consequences of your actions carry on through the next 3 games in the series, and beyond - to replay sorcery 1-4 again with increased difficulty because of the choices you made the first time through...

Probably the best "choose your own path/storyline" games ive ever played. Didn't play part 1 or 2 which I regret now, but this 3rd one was excellent!! Played it through multiple times, totally different experience/story each time, progressively getting better as I made better choices. Downloading 4 now! Keep up the good work.

I really enjoy this game but on ep2 and 3 i have encountered a problem, namely reloading if you die, it just takes me back to dead again with no other options x meaning i need to start again, maybe i should avoid death lol, would be nice i you could go two steps back rather than one x

This takes a really strong start of the series and adds innovative new ways to tell a very engaging story. There are so many different ways to accomplish so many different things in this game. It's the kind of thing puzzle games should aspire to be.

It is an impressive game with complex mechanics. The complexity is not just the input and output of the program, but the conceptual ideas as well. The game is truly impressive because I love how the developers bring forth the ideas of Steve Jackson and turn it into a digital game, which requires thought in improving and preserving the essence of the original story. For people, look up developers of the game and other games. You'll appreciate it more.
One of the best course your own adventure games
It's not really engaging. It feels random.

A masterpiece by mobile standards, part 3 in a four part series. Though not required, I highly recommend playing the earlier entries before trying this one out. A Choose Your Own Adventure on steroids with rpg mechanics.
These series will do well for a movie
Truly inspired stuff, bravo.
Even better than the previous 2 games in the series. The time travel mechanic is very novel, a welcome twist. I found it's also more challenging than either of the first two in the trilogy.
Love how the time serpent reacts after I rewinded. So much details!
Awsome, unique i've never played a game like this
It says downloading resources from play store and it's been downloading for 40 minutes now is that normal
Was Fun untill you lost the ability to rewind. then It just became a chore
Very fun use of extra time!! Story is great.

If you have no memory of using a book to play this kind of adventure, I am not sure that my recommendation applies to you. Excellent adventure, quite long if you get lost looking for a certain ennemy. about 7 to 9 hrs of playtime, but a definite replay value.

I absolutely love this game for the past year I have played them all non-stop trying to find every possible situation!!! I recently got a galaxy s7 active and now when ever I try to play the display is warped as if it needs to be played on a larger phone. It cuts off part of the game on the right and bottom sides of my phone keeping me from reading the story. I love this game and I'd love to keep playing it!!! Please fix this!!!
I hate this chapter. 3rd run, first run to kill all the serpents. It sucks when you go from 20 rations down to 1 due to getting a little wet.

Although as much as I want to do all things with grace, I am still tempted to do things like stealing. Haha! But I always felt guilty lol. So yeah, I'll just be graceful throughout.

I dont know if it was a labor of love or whatever, but these translations of the Sorcery series to mobile have been beyond my wildest dreams, i never thought they could have made it this fantastic. I am forever in awe of this achievement.

Absolutely loved this series as a kid and the digital version is damn near perfect. Having a blast going through these again.
A fantastic extension to the first two games, this dropped of my radar for a few years even though I was a massive fan. I check back now to see the final two installments are complete!   Good times

I played Sorcery 2 and wasn't disappointed. I wanted to know what happened next and bought this game. I can't tell which of both was best but they were both damn good. You're never let down by how good the news zones are and you feel like your skill matters to travel through the game better.

replyContent: Sorry about this! It's a graphics bug, an unexpected side-effect of updating all the Sorcery episodes to the latest code. We're working on a fix now; I'll let you know as soon as it's available. UPDATE: available now! Please let us know if it works for you.

content: One problem I found nothing on game play or story, just when my phone died while I was playing, the save I was playing for a few days was gone when I went back to it not sure if it's an issue with the game or not but I just continued the save from the other games again
Fantastic

Now combined with multi-sensory activation through modern tech that has only enhanced the gaming experience.  You have my loyalty Inkle, well done guys, keep on rockin' it.

I played #1 & 2 for free on Amazon Underground via my Kindle. Just had to buy #3. Each one seems to be less and less linear. This one kept me busy for a very long time. Sound and music is perfect. Epic story. The map of this one seemed huge when I started, only to find that there are multiple timelines within the same map, multiplying the size! I just finished this one (after 31 game days), and I just learned that #4 is to be released this week! Exciting! I'm just sad that this is the final chapter.
I love this game! Buy it! BUY IT FIVE TIMES!!
Please fix doesn't work with this device
Give us Sorcery 4 please. Or at least give us a date for god sake.
Not working after android update! Samsung s2
The best in its genre!

Each installment of this series gets exponentially better, and I couldn't believe the amount of care and work that these guys put into each one. The rewind is nice, and the time devices make double the story. I doubt that you could ever get tired of replays. Also, I love that your saved characters and accomplishments can carry over to each new one! >>>>>>>>>>>>>Spoiler Alert ( although I doubt it would mean anything to you unless you've played to where I am)<<<<<<<< Still don't know how to keep everything past the lake...I haven't spoiled it for myself by looking it up, but there must be a way! Amazing job doesn't even cover it guys, seriously. Buy all three, and also check out the Waywalkers series, Life of a Wizard, Zombie Exodus and A Wise Use of Time. Keep them coming!! : )

The best Sorcery! series so far. I enjoyed Shamutanti Hills and Khare, and this one just blew my mind. When I first played it I was expecting nothing special, I have read the book million times (and had it right next to me as I installed the game!), and I was amazed by all the new contents and mechanics introduced to the game. The :beacon of time" idea especially allowed devs to double the content in very creative way that fits the setting. Very replayable, as there are many options that are not obvious during the first playthrough, I replayed the game many more times compared to the first two. The QoL changes like improved rewinding was another nice feature. Certainly looking forward to the part 4.  Only minor thing was that it was really resource heavy compared to the first two, so my phone heats up rather quickly during the play (and randomly crashes if I play too long without cooling it down). But I think it is a minor inconvenience compared to what the gameplay offers.

Very, *very* good interpretation of a classic game book and a quantum leap from the first two which are excellent as well. Stylish, challenging and interesting yet a forgiving rewind system makes this something you can dip in and out of and keep you going for a few days. Hats off to inkle; fair price for an excellent production. Delighted. Guaranteed to buy the last entry. Please do more of these; obviously done by people who care about great deal about the original books.
great game
Brilliant game love story and music the magic is rly good aswell
OMG great game. More like this please!

I liked it until it crashed, and I had to start over.  Which I didn't. The ability to save would have meant no more than the last save gone, if even that.  Also, extremely high battery use even when idle with music turned off.  Busy-looping?

First, I always loved this format of adventure book, and from early days - so jumping into this style of game was a cinch. The game adopts a non-linear approach that is well implemented and great fun. Contains defects though, the game has crashed and most recently lost my game save data - over 6 hours gameplay! This is hugely frustrating, given the depth of discovery and items you would accrue in that time..  It's a bit like writing your end-of-term essay but forgetting to hit save, before Word crashes. Huf

Steve Jackson is the same man who made the board game Munchkin, so I knew that I was getting something good, but I was very surprised that the amount of polish that went into this game. Some people might not like that its text based and the only downside is that there's no multi-player. I didn't expect it to have multiplayer, being that it's a choose your own adventure style game but if it did somehow, I feel that it would have really set it over the top.
A great game, building on the series, looking forward to no.4

Explore a new world full of surprises, with a rich non-linear story featuring remarkably creative plot designs that all add to a dense atmosphere of awe and wonder. Buy this game! It's Choose Your Own Adventure, but for the 10-100 crowd, with amazing artwork that enhances storytelling and even changes things up from time to time (get it?). Ethical dilemmas, paths to trace and retrace, and improved gameplay enhanced by the novel (to me at least) engine that powered Sorcery! and Sorcery! 2. Bravo Inkle. Please don't interrupt Sorcery! 4 for another trip around the world. In closing, remember: Buy this game. OR, buy #1 and #2 and #3, play them all a few times, and then buy the Passepartout/Fogg epoch, which is a fine game also.

Remarkable.  Inkle have completely remodelled the Seven Serpents from the original gamebook, and made it the closest thing to a completely freeform adventure book that I've ever seen.  You can choose to go essentially anywhere, in any order you choose (and more than just any*where*).  There are multiple competing objectives which you need to trade off to complete this game.  Do you attempt to reach Mampang as fast as you can to reach the Archmage before the Serpents and his spies?  Do you attempt to kill all the Serpents?  Do you attempt to collect all the items that might aid you against the Archmage in the final book, hoping that you're powerful enough to face him down, despite allowing him foreknowledge of your arrival?  Highly, highly recommended.

I loved Sorcery.  Sorcery 2 was good, but frustrating at times.  Sorcery 3 was a big disappointment.  Overall the plot was uninteresting, some of the encounters didn't make much sense.  Serpent fights were often anticlimactic.  Finding how to go from one zone to another felt like a chore.

Coming back to khakabad and the baddu bak wastes after many years has been a great nostalgia trip. They've also greatly fleshed out the story, meaning the people here aren't simply evil obstacles to your progress: they have problems too and need your help! Simply wonderful and I can't wait for the final installment!

After many years of unsuccessful treatment, and hundreds of thousands of dollars spent in search of an effective treatment for my chronic 3d vision, all it took was a mobile game of all things to cure my condition. Now I see in full 4d HD vision 10/10 would see again.

(Mild Spoilers to anyone who hasn't played) Really loving this game. Playing it on my Moto g 2, and the game crashes when i try to continue. I am travelling on the lake with the ferryman, and when the serpent leaves him I get the the dialogue "You travel for a moment in silence". When  The ferryman goes still, I shake him, draw my sword, and then click fight. The initial dialogue along with the image displays but in the actual combat the air serpent's character is not there, there is no dialogue hints/tells, just blank paper. It gets to a certain point where if I try to fight, guessing semi-randomly, the game crashes unless i click defend.  Please fix this. Excellent work otherwise.

How come the top 4 mobile games I've ever played have been created by the same people? 80 days and all three entries of the Sorcery! series. The storytelling, the atmosphere, the amount of content, everything tops most modern console games. It's a work of art, made with passion, polished to the last detail. So many approaches, so many stories to read and live through. You guys are the best mobile developer out there, scares me to think what your potential could do on bigger platforms. 5 stars forever.

Well, I've been hooked on Sorcery! since the first game and it hasn't disappointed through both 2 and 3. It was thoroughly enjoyable to continue my adventure, if not a little harder to finish. Sorcery! 3 is the first game in the series, to me, that makes my character feel alone. I found myself hoping for villages and waiting for an intelligent creature to trade with (or steal from). I also strongly loved the emphasis on magic and spellcasting introduced in 3. One of the best game series on GPlay.

I agree, best of the series. Also, most challenging! Saving Khare was somewhat difficult but I'm at five serpents and the other two are giving me a run for my money. Great job Inkle! Well worth the wait, immersive, much bigger, and makes you think.

I loved it from start to finish! However I do have some nitpicks. The letters for the spells were smaller and I dislike it, and the rewind system I loathe, but other than that it was great. Keep it up!

I was expecting Sorcery 2 kind of faithful adaptation with imaginative twist to it, but rather Sorcery 3 SURPASSED the expectation in EVERY CONCEIVABLE WAYS. Its crazy! The backstory of the land that is not in the book is now part of the adventure, and omg! How much i love time shenanigans and this alone makes the game extremely replayable! Well done inkle!!! It is indeed very impressive! Would totally recommend this to friends. :)

After having some issues on my end resolved, I can now get it downloaded and installed and can play through both the first two chapters again to reacquaint myself with the storyline again and play the third installment of an already fun series!
replyContent:
Hi Russell, here are some things to try:
- Check that you have enough free storage (280MB needed)
- Remove the SD card before installing.

If those don't work, send us an email and we'll try to figure it out!

content: This game is fantastic. I feel like Sorcery! 1 and 2 were training for getting around this game. I've played through "successfully" (killed all seven serpents) and played around a bit with some side quests, but it's clear this game is thick with storylines that can't all be done in one reading. While this was also true in this first two installments to some extent, this game takes it to a whole new level. Black and white characters have become completely muddled, and this game leaves you questioning everyones motives, including your own. Even now, I'm not so sure that killing all seven serpents is necessarily the "best" way to do this game, or at least not the most interesting. Finally most of the elusive spell items that were not part of the first two games can be gathered in the Baklands. Experimenting with different spells in each situation is much more rewarding than it was before. inkle++

I almost didn't even try the first one, but now I am addicted and I cannot wait for the fourth. This one greatly expands in what was great from the second one. Better exploration and a basically 2 worlds to explore made it so much more enthralling. Basically played 3 straight days of this :p wife isn't too happy :)
The game is now much longer and it has much more detail.

I was somewhat dissapointed with sorcery 3 to be honest. My dissapointment started when i almost one shot my first serpent. Then more dissapointment when i fumbled around in the 2nd zone trying to get out. Then i fumbled around in the 3rd zone trying to kill a time serpent. After a long time i decided to look online as it seemed the only way. I was hyped up for my amazing final boss fight, however when i got there i one shot the time serpent  without a fight! Khare city port of traps is 3 times as good!
Fantastic best one yet

Inkle keeps making Sorcery!  better at evert installment. The art work and background sound really brings this game to life. Kinda wish they could release all 4 parts at PSN, Xbox store,  or even the 3ds so others could try this amazing game.

This game lets you go anywhere at anytime. It gives an unparalleled level of freedom and fun to the sorcery series. Manage your resources and you will have a blast. I also recommend you let yourself be cursed by Lorag at the end of Sorcery! 2 for at least one playthrough.

replyContent: This forum might be a place for hints (http://forums.toucharcade.com/showthread.php?t=260068&page=11), otherwise, the Marsh Goblins of Vischlami have a vital clue but you'll need help translating it.

content: The game is amazing! I wish to thank you very much for the great work and experince that you've created. Keep calm and carry on :)

I played the Sorcery! gamebooks as a kid when they first came out, and I find myself eagerly anticipating each new installment now as I did all those years ago. The apps don't quite capture the foreboding tone that the gamebooks did for me as a child, however they're so much more than the gamebooks could possibly be. Kudos to Inkle (and Steve Jackson) for taking it to the next level and doing such a great job on the Sorcery! games!
Played thru the 1st and 2nd abt 5-6 times great games and i have no doubt this one will be too!

All the hardwork is paid off, this is the incredible bravery to allow the game to go open world . Doing this again one more time in the last chapter and you will achieve the impossible . the best adapt game in the whole game world history , i will keep my finger cross Keep this on Inkle
